page.title: 05Farming In Nantwich.
page.content: Nantwich is a small rural town.It is surrounded by farms of which 54 are to be found within a 5 kilometre radius of the town centre. {Farming}is nearly all{dairy.}The main breed of cattle is Friesian.They are kept for their milk which also means that the main crop grown is grass.The cattle either eat it in the field or are fed it as hay in Winter. The winter housing of cattle in cubicles gives rise to unpleasent smells drifting over domestic areas when the cattles waste,called slurry, is removed and spread over the fields as fertiliser.Slurry is liquid manure and is stored in large ponds called lagoons. In Nantwich there is one dairy and three shops specialising in{dairy {products}including milk,cream and of course,{Cheshire cheese.
